text: Northern LifeLock is the largest Cypher
safety Consumer Protection company in
the world and we have tens of millions
of customers protecting hundreds of
millions of devices I'm responsible for
Norton backend Services as well as a
cloud migration when you look at
latencies there's actually two parts of
it because we'll build a VPN server it
sort of sits in the middle the client
talked to our VPN server and our server
talked to whatever the destination is
most Industries they care about the
first leg which is you know from the
client tongue to your your backend
services but for us the second part is
actually really really more important
because that's directly impact customers
experience so we use AWS local zones
to solve this problem by deploying our
Edge servers in those local zones this
allows reduce the latency between our
client to the ad servers we deploy
and at the same time allows the customer
traffic to enter into AWS Network as
quickly and as as surely as possible
after we deploy the local zones we saw
about 60 reduction in latency
up to 90 reduction in terms of distance
between where the customer is
to the first VPN server hits before we
migrate AWS we were working with our
party providers released servers from
them but due to the Quality the bad
quality of the the provider's
infrastructure as well as the way we
deploy our servers we run into a lot of
customer related issues when we
introduce local zones we saw about 20
percent uh increase in download speed
and a dramatic drop in terms of customer
support calls
